history.content: It will depend on how full those classes are. You may want to send e-mail to the instructors of the classes sometime near the beginning of class (it's nearly impossible to reach most faculty during the summer; I've tried!) and introduce yourself. As a new grad student, you will Phase 1 during the summer and then you will be able to see better what the situation looks like.

<md>Hello, I'm currently a Senior in EECS but I'm returning next semester for a Master's in another department (interested in applying ML to another field plus it's fully funded). How does enrolling in EECS grad courses work as a grad student in another department? I'm interested in taking some more specific grad-level ML classes to build upon what I learned as an EECS undergrad. As an undergrad I've already taken 189, 182, 127.</md>
history.subject: Enrolling in CS Grad Courses as a Non-CS Grad Student
